Scramble a vector of values

scramble_values.Rd

Scramble a vector of values

Usage

scramble_values(x)

Arguments

x

a vector x

Value

the scrambled vector

Examples


# Example with character vector
set.seed(123)

x <- letters[1:10]
scramble_values(x)
#>  [1] "c" "j" "b" "h" "f" "i" "a" "g" "e" "d"

#' # Example with numeric vector
nums <- 1:5
scramble_values(nums)
#> [1] 2 3 1 4 5

# Scramble the 'ecology' variable in the 'williams' dataset using dplyr
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
data(williams)

williams |>
mutate(ecology = scramble_values(ecology))
#> # A tibble: 112 × 25
#>    subject   SexUnres_1 SexUnres_2 SexUnres_3 SexUnres_4_r SexUnres_5_r Impuls_1
